decks.notes: This deck focuses on using board control and sustainable card advantage to outlast opponents, with cards that provide value through synergistic interactions. By utilizing a mix of creatures, spells, and lands, the deck seeks to control the game tempo and apply pressure when necessary. The strategy revolves around setting up powerful combos, maximizing resource usage, and adapting to various threats. The goal is to establish dominance on the battlefield and overwhelm opponents with a well-balanced mix of aggression and defense.

This deck focuses on controlling the game with a combination of card draw, land reanimation, and powerful spells. It utilizes cards like Memory Deluge and Nissa, Resurgent Animist to gain card advantage and tempo. The mana base is focused on balancing the colors needed for spells like Virtue of Strength and Ill-Timed Explosion. The inclusion of Splendid Reclamation and Fallaji Archaeologist allows for potential land recursion and additional resources. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents through a combination of control elements and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on using a combination of card draw, removal spells, and powerful creatures to control the pace of the game and out-value opponents. By utilizing cards like Aftermath Analyst and Memory Deluge for card advantage, along with powerful spells like Virtue of Strength and Worldsoul's Rage, the deck aims to continuously disrupt opponents' game plans while also building up a strong board presence. The inclusion of Nissa, Resurgent Animist and other late-game threats ensures that the deck can close out games decisively once it gains control of the battlefield.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game using a mix of spells and creatures from the Temur color combination, focusing on generating card advantage and maintaining board presence. The deck utilizes cards like Aftermath Analyst and Virtue of Strength to establish control, while also incorporating cards like Memory Deluge and Nissa, Resurgent Animist for card draw and ramp. Brokers Hideout and Maestros Theater offer additional value generation, while Ill-Timed Explosion and Vampires' Vengeance provide removal options. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and overwhelm them with powerful spells and creatures.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive early game plays with efficient creatures and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes powerful cards like Knight-Errant of Eos and Resolute Reinforcements to establish a strong battlefield presence. The deck also features versatile cards like Mirrex and Novice Inspector to provide card advantage and board control. With a mix of burn spells like Gleeful Demolition and creatures like Voldaren Epicure, this deck aims to put constant pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control spells to disrupt opponents and protect its own game plan. It aims to control the board with removal spells like "Go for the Throat" and "Path of Peril" while also countering key spells with cards like "Negate" and "Duress". The deck also includes card draw and recursion with cards like "Memory Deluge" and "Deadly Cover-Up". By generating card advantage and disrupting the opponent's strategy, it aims to outvalue and outlast the opposition in a game of attrition.

This Esper Aggro deck emphasizes fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells to control the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent quickly. The deck focuses on exploiting the synergy between its creatures and various support cards to maintain board presence and apply constant pressure. Key cards include Faerie Mastermind, Raffine, Scheming Seer, and Wedding Announcement, which work together to create a strong and versatile offensive strategy. By efficiently using its resources and leveraging its cards' abilities, this deck aims to secure victory through a proactive and aggressive playstyle.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outlast the opponent. It utilizes cards like No More Lies and Disruption Protocol to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also using cards like Memory Deluge and Meticulous Archive to maintain card advantage. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Hullbreaker Horror and The Wandering Emperor to close out the game once control has been established. Overall, the goal is to efficiently control the board and hand while slowly building up an advantage to win the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays using cheap creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It includes cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Play with Fire for early pressure, along with Kumano Faces Kakkazan for removal and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance for late-game dominance. The deck also includes utility cards like Feldon, Ronom Excavator and Mishra's Foundry to maintain board presence and generate value. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature damage and direct burn spells to secure a swift victory.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a mix of creature removal, card advantage, and tempo plays to overwhelm the opponent. Aftermath Analyst and Fallaji Archaeologist provide card draw and recursion, while Ill-Timed Explosion and Virtue of Strength handle opposing threats. Maestros Theater and Memory Deluge help dig for key cards, while Kellan, Inquisitive Prodigy and Nissa, Resurgent Animist offer additional value. Colossal Skyturtle and Worldsoul's Rage provide win conditions, with Shigeki, Jukai Visionary and Vampires' Vengeance offering versatility in dealing with various situations.

This deck focuses on controlling the board with a mix of removal, counterspells, and big creatures. The key strategy is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Herd Migration and Up the Beanstalk to cast powerful threats like Archangel of Wrath and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. Leyline Binding helps to keep opposing threats in check, while cards like Ill-Timed Explosion and Invasion of Zendikar provide additional removal options. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents with large creatures and powerful spells while maintaining control over the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and removal spells to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total. It also includes support cards that enhance the abilities of the creatures and provide additional utility. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the spells and creatures in the deck. The overall strategy is to apply pressure early, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and maintain a strong presence on the battlefield to secure victory.
